title: What did Elton John reportedly say about Michael Jackson is his new book?
text:
Sir Elton reportedly had a thing or two to say about MJ… (Pictures: by Samir Hussein/WireImage/ LOS ANGELES TIMES/AFP/Getty Images)

Sir Elton John is said to mention Michael Jackson in his upcoming book, Me: Elton John, which is due to be released on 15 October.

The piano-playing music icon reportedly claims in his memoir that Jackson was ‘a disturbing person’.

And that’s not all that Sir Elton apparently has to say about the Billie Jean singer…

What did Elton John say about Michael Jackson?

According to Radar Online, Sir Elton questions ‘what prescription drugs [Michael Jackson] was being pumped full of’.

The Rocket Man singer allegedly wrote: ‘The poor guy looked awful, really frail and ill,’ and that Jackson’s nose was ‘covered with a sticking plaster’ and his make-up had been applied by a ‘maniac’.

The book is said to read: ‘For whatever reason, he couldn’t seem to cope with adult company at all.’

Sir Elton reportedly also wrote that Jackson was ‘genuinely mentally ill, a disturbing person to be around’ and that he had ‘totally lost his marbles’ by the 2000s.

Radar Online reports that Jackson disappeared ‘without a word’ from a lunch with Sir Elton, and was found later in the cottage belonging to the now-72-year-old’s housekeeper ‘quietly playing games’ with her 11-year-old son.

Jackson, who died in 2009, was the subject of the Emmy-award winning docuseries Leaving Neverland, which came out this year and details allegations of child abuse made against Jackson by two men – James Safechuck and Wade Robson – who knew Jackson as children.

Jackson’s family and estate have been vocal in their defense of the King of Pop, with a previous statement from his estate reading: ‘Leaving Neverland isn’t a documentary, it is the kind of tabloid character assassination Michael Jackson endured in life, and now in death.

‘The film takes uncorroborated allegations that supposedly happened 20 years ago and treats them as fact.’

Me: Elton John is out on 15 October.
